Introduction
GnomeSword2 is a Bible study and research tool based upon the "SWORD Project" libraries and the GNOME Desktop libraries.GnomeSword2 aims to provide a simple and clean user interface whilst providing a powerful tool allowing a personalized Bible study environment.
Notice
GnomeSword2 is currently in development, so this manual may not reflect the program as you see it. If it does not, please file a bug at the project website, or email gnomesword-developers@lists.sourceforge.net.
Getting Started
To Start GnomeSword2
You can start GnomeSword2 in the following ways.
Applicationsmenu
Choose Accessories Gnomesword .
Command line
Type gnomesword2, then press Return.
Starting GnomeSword2 The First Time
When you start GnomeSword2 for the first time,you will be presented by a simple Setup Druid dialog. This will enable you to configure your SWORD Project modules and basic user interface options.
When You Start GnomeSword2
When you start GnomeSword2, the following interface is displayed:
GnomeSword2 interface
GnomeSword2 window
The GnomeSword2 interface contains the following elements:
Menubar
The menus on the menubar contain several commands which extend the use of gnomesword. These include the studypad and advanced search functions. The menus also allow you to customize your use of gnomesword.
Accessories Bible Application . Toolbar
The toolbar contains buttons that let you navigate through the Bible.
Side Pane
The Side pane provides access to several features. It contains your bookmarks and the list of installed books. It can also be used for simple searches.
Bible Text Pane
The Bible Text Pane displays the Bible text which is currently being viewed.
Commentary Pane
The Commentary Pane displays commentaries on the current Bible Text being used.
Dictionary/Book Pane
The Dictionary/Book Pane displays dictionary information on selected words in the Bible Text Pane.
When you right-click in the GnomeSword2 window, the application displays a popup menu. The popup menu contains the most common text editing commands.

The Interface
The Toolbar
The Toolbar
The Toolbar
The first two buttons on the toolbar are toggle buttons,which enables quick switching between options.The first being a dictionary view toggle and the second aparallel view toggle. When you press button toggles the dictionary view,enabling fast switching between the dictionary and the general books that you have installed on your system. The second icon/button switches between the main bible view and the parallel view. In order to utilize the parallel view correctly, please ensure that your SWORD module configuration for the parallel view is set up correctly.
For more information on SWORD module configuration within GnomeSword2 please consult the Preferences section of this document.
Next to the two toggle buttons is the current book,chapter and verse. Here you can select your book by simply clicking on the book box and selecting your book.You can also type the desired book into the book box. You can increment and decrement the chapter and verse values by clicking on the chapter or verse value boxes. By changing the book, chapter or verse information via clicking on their boxes, the changes will have immediate effect on your Bible text. Next to these you will find a summarized version which the user can edit manually. If the value is edited in the summarized text box, the button on the right of it will transport you to your desired destination.
Please ensure that the summarized box has the correct book,chapter and verse value otherwise your result might be unexpected.

The Side Pane
The Side Pane
The Side Pane
On the left hand side of GnomeSword2 there is the shortcut bar. Here the user can quickly and easily switch between the different Bible texts, commentaries,dictionaries and general books. Also, you can select and edit your bookmarks,view search results, view verse lists and view your daily devotional book by simply clicking on the module icon and select your selection.
The Bible Text Pane
The Bible Text Pane
The Bible Text Pane
Positioned to the right of the Shortcut bar is the Bible text dialog.Here All your different translations will be displayed for full viewing.When starting GnomeSword2 either your default Bible translation or the translation last used will be displayed.
Opening A Specific Bible Translation
In order to change the current Bible translation to another of your choice simply:
right-click in the Bible Translation Display didArea.In the popup menu choose FileOpen Module and select your specific translation that you want to view.
under the Modules option in the Shortbutbar,choose Biblical Textslanguage choice and select your specific translation.
Opening A Seperate Bible Translation
In order to view a Bible translation seperate from the GnomeSword2 interface,simply:
right-click in the Bible Translation Display Area.In the popup menu choose FileOpen current in a dialog Module .
under the Modules option in the Shortbutbar,choose Biblical Textslanguage choice .Then right-click on your specific translation and choose the Open in dialog option.
